intro: Ditaxis polygama, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
